title: Tools
description: Functions exposed by MCP servers that the AI model can invoke to perform actions

notes.1: JetBrains AI Assistant only supports stdio transport - workaround needed for remote MCP servers

vscode+github-copilot.evidence: Tools explicitly listed as supported: 'MCP tools work like other tools in VS Code: they can be automatically invoked when using agents or explicitly referenced in your prompts.'

visual-studio+github-copilot.evidence: GitHub Copilot MCP support applies across IDEs including Visual Studio. Tools supported per docs.

jetbrains+github-copilot.evidence: GitHub Copilot MCP support applies across IDEs. Docs state tools are supported.

xcode+github-copilot.evidence: GitHub Copilot MCP support applies across IDEs including Xcode. Tools supported per docs.

android-studio+github-copilot.evidence: GitHub Copilot MCP support applies across IDEs including Android Studio. Tools supported per docs.

neovim+github-copilot.evidence: GitHub Copilot MCP support not available for Neovim - only VS Code, Visual Studio, JetBrains, Xcode.

emacs+github-copilot.evidence: GitHub Copilot MCP support not available for Emacs - only VS Code, Visual Studio, JetBrains, Xcode.

vscode+cline.evidence: Tools supported: 'MCP servers define a set of tools, which are functions the LLM can execute.'

jetbrains+cline.evidence: Cline uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools supported per docs.

android-studio+cline.evidence: Cline uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools supported per docs.

vscode+continue.evidence: Tools supported: 'Tools map to Tools in Continue'

jetbrains+continue.evidence: Continue uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. 'Tools map to Tools in Continue.'

android-studio+continue.evidence: Continue uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools map to Tools per docs.

vscode+cody.evidence: Tools supported: 'Cody now supports MCP tools via its agentic context gathering, enabling automated tool use to gather and inject context directly into Cody responses.'

jetbrains+cody.evidence: Cody uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools supported via agentic context gathering.

visual-studio+cody.evidence: Cody uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools supported via agentic context gathering.

android-studio+cody.evidence: Cody uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools supported via agentic context gathering.

vscode+tabnine.evidence: Tools supported: 'MCP servers act as standardized interfaces that allow language models to communicate with external applications or systems.'

jetbrains+tabnine.evidence: Tabnine uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools supported per docs.

visual-studio+tabnine.evidence: Tabnine Agent MCP support works across IDEs including Visual Studio. Tools supported per docs.

android-studio+tabnine.evidence: Tabnine Agent MCP support works across IDEs including Android Studio. Tools supported per docs.

neovim+tabnine.evidence: Tabnine MCP support applies across IDEs. Tools supported per docs.

vscode+codeium.evidence: No MCP support in Codeium VS Code extension. MCP is only available in Windsurf IDE, Codeium's standalone product.

jetbrains+codeium.evidence: No MCP support in Codeium JetBrains extension. MCP is only in Windsurf IDE.

neovim+codeium.evidence: No MCP support in Codeium Neovim plugin. MCP is only in Windsurf IDE.

android-studio+codeium.evidence: No MCP support in Codeium Android Studio extension. MCP is only available in Windsurf IDE.

vscode+amazonq.evidence: Tools explicitly supported with permission levels (auto-approved, requires approval, dangerous) and discovery via /tools command.

jetbrains+amazonq.evidence: Amazon Q uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools explicitly supported.

visual-studio+amazonq.evidence: Amazon Q uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools explicitly supported.

android-studio+amazonq.evidence: Amazon Q uses same MCP implementation across IDEs. Tools explicitly supported.

cursor+native.evidence: Tools explicitly listed as supported: 'Functions for the AI model to execute'

windsurf+native.evidence: Tools explicitly supported per documentation and verified by multiple sources.

zed+native.evidence: Tools explicitly supported - documentation focuses on 'tools coming from MCP servers' with configuration in custom profiles.

zed+claude-code.evidence: Uses Claude Code's MCP implementation. Claude Code supports tools.

zed+codex-cli.evidence: Tools supported. Uses Codex CLI's MCP implementation. OpenAI docs: 'MCP servers are supported by both the Codex CLI and the Codex IDE extension.'

jetbrains+native.evidence: Tools supported via stdio: 'AI Assistant can interact with external tools and data sources via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). By connecting to MCP servers, AI Assistant gains access to a range of tools.'

neovim+avante.evidence: Tools supported via mcp_tool() function adding use_mcp_tool capability.

neovim+codecompanion.evidence: Tools supported with 'Flexible Tool Access' - multiple ways from broad @mcp access to granular individual tools.

neovim+amp.evidence: Amp MCP support applies across IDEs including Neovim. Tools supported.

neovim+augment.evidence: Augment MCP support applies across IDEs including Neovim. Tools supported.

emacs+gptel.evidence: gptel supports MCP tools. Per docs: gptel is a multi-LLM client with MCP support.

emacs+ellama.evidence: Ellama does not have MCP support per GitHub repository review.

claude-desktop+native.evidence: Claude Desktop is Anthropic's native MCP implementation. Tools fully supported.

claude-code+native.evidence: Claude Code supports MCP tools for development workflows. Per PulseMCP: 'Enables tool discovery and execution.'

codex-cli+native.evidence: Codex CLI supports MCP tools per OpenAI documentation.

gemini-cli+native.evidence: Gemini CLI supports MCP tools per documentation.

void+native.evidence: Tools supported. DeepWiki docs: 'Agent mode can search, create, edit, and delete files & folders. It also has terminal access and MCP tool access.'

pearai+native.evidence: Tools supported. PearAI is a fork of Continue which supports MCP tools. PearAI submodule inherits Continue's MCP implementation.

firebase-studio+native.evidence: Tools supported: 'Tools provided by MCP servers' explicitly listed as supported feature.

jules+native.evidence: No native MCP client support. Jules is an async coding agent that doesn't consume MCP servers. Third-party MCP servers exist FOR Jules, but Jules itself is not an MCP client.

lovable+native.evidence: Lovable supports MCP tools on Business/Enterprise plans with prebuilt connectors.

xcode+native.evidence: No MCP support - Xcode has no built-in MCP integration, only third-party plugins like GitHub Copilot.

android-studio+native.evidence: Android Studio has Gemini integration but MCP support comes via third-party plugins or Gemini Code Assist.

vscode+amp.evidence: Amp supports MCP tools per documentation.

jetbrains+amp.evidence: Amp supports MCP tools per documentation.

neovim+amp.evidence: Amp MCP support applies across IDEs including Neovim. Tools supported.

amp+native.evidence: Amp supports MCP tools per documentation.

vscode+augment.evidence: Augment supports MCP tools per documentation.

jetbrains+augment.evidence: Augment supports MCP tools per documentation.

neovim+augment.evidence: Augment MCP support applies across IDEs including Neovim. Tools supported.

vscode+gemini-code-assist.evidence: Tools supported in agent mode: 'Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers and their executable functions' listed as available tools.

jetbrains+gemini-code-assist.evidence: MCP server support is NOT supported in Gemini Code Assist for IntelliJ or other JetBrains IDEs per Google documentation.

android-studio+gemini-code-assist.evidence: MCP server support is NOT supported in Android Studio (JetBrains-based IDE) per Google documentation.
